text: Carl Wilhelm Scheele (December 9, 1742 - May 21, 1786) a German-Swedish pharmaceutical chemist, born in Stralsund, Western Pomerania, Germany (at the time under Swedish rule), was the discoverer of many chemical substances, most notably discovering oxygen before Joseph Priestley and chlorine before Humphry Davy. Category:1742 births Category:1786 deaths Category:German chemists Category:People from Mecklenburg-Vorpommern Category:Swedish scientists
title: Carl Wilhelm Scheele
